interpolator module

This module includes the main linear- and nearest-neighbor interpolator used in AdvDiff.

@author: Ketil

class interpolator.meshA_to_meshB(meshA_points, meshB_points, extrap_qhull=False)

Bases: object

Generalized interpolator class. meshA_to_meshB object which can be used to interpolate values defined on a set of points defined on meshA to a set of points defined on meshB.

This interpolator was based on the methods and ideas introduced in: * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/20915502/speedup-scipy-griddata-for-multiple-interpolations-between-two-irregular-grids * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/51858194/storing-the-weights-used-by-scipy-griddata-for-re-use * https://programtalk.com/python-examples/scipy.interpolate.griddata.ravel/

Special thanks to Jaime for his excellent linear interpolator function.

Parameters

  • meshA_points (array ([n_points,2])) – Array of cellcenter points from meshA.

  • meshB_points (array ([n_points,2])) – Array of cellcenter points from meshB.

  • extrap_qhull (bool) – Whether or not to force nearest extrapolation on points lying on the convex hull.

Return type

meshA_to_meshB object

extrapolate_nans(meshA_points, meshB_points, dataA, dataB, extrap_from_A=True)

Extrapolate any NANs using nearest neighbour interpolation which might arrise from linear interpolation.

Parameters

  • meshA_points (array ([n_points_A, 2])) – A numpy array containing [x,y] coordinates for points on meshA.

  • meshB_points (array ([n_points_B, 2])) – A numpy array containing [x,y] coordinates for points on meshB.

  • dataA (array ([n_points_A, 1])) – A numpy array containing data values for each point on meshA.

  • dataB (array ([n_points_B, 1])) – A numpy array containing data values for each point on meshB.

  • extrap_from_A (bool, optional) – Whether or not to extrapolate using data from A or B, by default True

Returns

dataB – Extrapolated values on meshB.

Return type

array ([n_points_B, 1])

interp_weights(meshA_points, meshB_points, d=2)

Compute the necessary triangularization, vertices and weights. This method is called only once during initialization of the meshA_to_meshB object.

Parameters

  • meshA_points (array ([n_points_A, 2])) – A numpy array containing [x,y] coordinates for points on meshA.

  • meshB_points (array ([n_points_B, 2])) – A numpy array containing [x,y] coordinates for points on meshB.

  • d (int, optional) – An integer setting the dimensionality, by default 2.

Returns

  • triA (object) – A scipy.spatial.Delaynay object containing the triangularization of meshA.

  • vertices (array) – A numpy array containing the vertices of meshA.

  • weights (array) – A numpy array containing the corresponding weights.

interpolate(data, extrap_nans=True, extrap_from_A=True, fill_value=0.0)

Interpolate data (defined on meshA) onto points on meshB using linear interpolation. It is higly recommended to keep extrap_nans=True. If extrap_nans=True, then .extrapolate_nans() is automatically called to patch any NANs which may arrise.

Parameters

  • data (array ([n_points_A, 1])) – A numpy array containing data defined on meshA.

  • extrap_nans (bool, optional) – Whether or not to extrapolate NAN values, by default True.

  • extrap_from_A (bool, optional) – Whether or not to extrapolate NAN values by data defined on meshA, by default True.

  • fill_value (float, optional) – What value to fill NANs with is extrap_nans = False, by default 0.0.

Returns

data_interp – Interpolated data defined on meshB.

Return type

array ([n_points_B, 1])

interpolate_nearest(data)

Interpolate data (defined on meshA) onto points on meshB using nearest neighbor interpolation.

Parameters

data (array ([n_points_A, 1])) – A numpy array containing data defined on meshA.

Returns

data_interp – Interpolated data defined on meshB.

Return type

array ([n_points_B, 1])

nearest_value(tree, values, xi)

Computes the nearest value to the points in xi.

Parameters

  • tree (object) – Scipy.spatial.KDTree object

  • values (array) – Values to query.

  • xi (array) – A numpy array containing points to query.

Returns

values – A numpy array containing the nearest values for each point in xi.

Return type

array
